name: frege108d
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0
body: |- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c3), wceq(c0, c3)))

|- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2))

-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, universe))
-| wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c3), wceq(c0, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wbr(c3, c1, c2))

comment: If either ` A ` and ` C ` are the same or ` C ` follows ` A ` in the transitive closure of ` R ` _and_ ` B ` is the successor to ` C ` , then either ` A ` and ` B ` are the same or ` B ` follows ` A ` in the transitive closure of ` R ` . Similar to Proposition 108 of [Frege1879] p. 74. Compare with ~ frege108 . (Contributed by RP, 15-Jul-2020.)
